text: The 2020 Blackwater Elite season will be the 6th season of the franchise in the Philippine Basketball Association (PBA). ==Key dates== * December 8: The 2019 PBA draft took place on Robinsons Place Manila. * March 11: The PBA postpones the season due to the threat of the coronavirus. ==Draft picks== ===Special draft=== {| class="wikitable sortable sortable" style="text-align: center" ! style=";"|Pick ! style=";"|Player ! style=";"|Position ! style=";"|Nationality ! style=";"|College/Club |- | 2 | Rey Suerte | SG | | UE |} ===Regular draft=== {| class="wikitable sortable sortable" style="text- align: center" ! style=";"|Round ! style=";"|Pick ! style=";"|Player ! style=";"|Position ! style=";"|Nationality ! style=";"|College/Club |- | 1 | 2 | Maurice Shaw | C | | Hutchinson CC |- | 2 | 14 | Richard Escoto | PF | | Far Eastern |- | 3 | 25 | Chris Bitoon | PG | | St. Clare |- | 4 | 37 | Hubert Cani | PG | | Far Eastern |} ==Roster== ==Philippine Cup== ===Eliminations=== ====Standings==== ====Game log==== |-bgcolor=bbffbb | 1 | October 12 | NorthPort | W 96–89 | Sumang, Trollano (17) | Don Trollano (10) | 5 players (2) | AUF Sports Arena & Cultural Center | 1–0 |-bgcolor=ffcccc | 2 | October 15 | Ginebra | L 99–103 | Don Trollano (23) | Don Trollano (10) | Sumang, Daquioag (4) | AUF Sports Arena & Cultural Center | 1–1 |-bgcolor=bbffbb | 3 | October 17 | NLEX | W 98–88 | Canaleta, Trollano (18) | Don Trollano (11) | Ed Daquioag (8) | AUF Sports Arena & Cultural Center | 2–1 ==Transactions== ===Trades=== ====Preseason==== {| border=1 style="border-collapse:collapse; text-align: center; width: 100%" bordercolor="#DFDFDF" cellpadding="5" |- bgcolor="eeeeee" !style="" colspan=4|January |- | style="width:12%" rowspan=1 | January 16, 2020 | style="width:50%" valign="top"| To Blackwater * * * Ron Dennison | style="width:50%" valign="top"| To Phoenix * * * Brian Heruela |} {| border=1 style="border-collapse:collapse; text-align: center; width: 100%" bordercolor="#DFDFDF" cellpadding="5" |- bgcolor="eeeeee" !style="" colspan=4|February |- | style="width:12%" rowspan=1 | February 28, 2020 | style="width:29.3%" valign="top"| To Blackwater * * * Marion Magat (from TNT) Yousef Taha (from TNT) Ed Daquioag (from TNT via Rain or Shine) 2021 first round pick (from TNT) 2022 first round pick (from TNT) | style="width:29.3%" valign="top"| To NLEX * * * Anthony Semerad (from Blackwater) Rabeh Al-Hussaini (from Blackwater) 2020 first round pick (from Blackwater) 2021 second round pick (from Blackwater) | style="width:29.3%" valign="top"| To TNT * * * John Paul Erram (from Blackwater via NLEX) |} ===Free agents=== ====Rookie Signings==== {| class="wikitable sortable sortable" style="text-align: center" ! style="" width="10%"| Player ! style="" width="10%" | Signed ! style="" width="10%"| School/club |- style="text-align: center" | Maurice Shaw | December 15, 2019 | Power Electricity Authority (PEA) |- style="text-align: center" | Richard Escoto | December 22, 2019 | Far Eastern |} ==References== Category:Blackwater Bossing seasons Blackwater Elite
